comments.body:
Is this returning a different value in your environment than just using the built-in values provided by Salt grains?

grains['fqdn'] should hold the fully qualified domain name, but maybe there is something unique about your setup?
grains['id'] also should hold the same value by default.

Just looking to see if we can avoid defining a new field.

Here is what I'm getting in Azure:

```
jeffm@kubes-master:~$ sudo salt '*' grains.items | grep id
  cpu_flags: fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca cmov pat pse36 clflush mmx fxsr sse sse2 syscall nx mmxext fxsr_opt lm 3dnowext 3dnow rep_good nopl extd_apicid pni cx16 popcnt hypervisor lahf_lm cmp_legacy cr8_legacy abm sse4a misalignsse 3dnowprefetch osvw
  id: kubes-master
  lsb_distrib_id: Ubuntu
  server_id: 1561805789
  cbr-cidr: 10.244.1.0/24
  cpu_flags: fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca cmov pat pse36 clflush mmx fxsr sse sse2 syscall nx mmxext fxsr_opt lm 3dnowext 3dnow rep_good nopl extd_apicid pni cx16 popcnt hypervisor lahf_lm cmp_legacy cr8_legacy abm sse4a misalignsse 3dnowprefetch osvw
  id: kubes-minion-1

  cpu_flags: fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca cmov pat pse36 clflush mmx fxsr sse sse2 syscall nx mmxext fxsr_opt lm 3dnowext 3dnow rep_good nopl extd_apicid pni cx16 popcnt hypervisor lahf_lm cmp_legacy cr8_legacy abm sse4a misalignsse 3dnowprefetch osvw
  id: kubes-minion-2
  lsb_distrib_id: Ubuntu
  server_id: 2110708182
jeffm@kubes-master:~$ sudo salt '*' grains.items | grep fqdn
  fqdn: kubes-master
  fqdn_ip4:
  fqdn_ip6:
  fqdn: kubes-minion-1
  fqdn_ip4:
  fqdn_ip6:
  fqdn: kubes-minion-2
  fqdn_ip4:
  fqdn_ip6:
jeffm@kubes-master:~$ sudo salt '*' grains.items | grep hostname
  hostnamef: kubes-minion-1.kube-0b57586.d5.internal.cloudapp.net
  hostnamef: kubes-minion-2.kube-0b57586.d5.internal.cloudapp.net
jeffm@kubes-master:~$ 
```

If there is something I can do to poke salt to get the full hostname, that would be great.

grains['fqdn'] appears to be unreliable, as it depends on what is being set into the /etc/hosts file:

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/salt-users/5-4i_HDmhQM

So I think this approach is ok.
